alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 09 at 2:19AM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGH COUNTRY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .A storm system is expected to bring heavy snow to the north central mountains of Colorado starting late Friday morning and continue through Saturday afternoon. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur in the Park and Gore Ranges with storm totals up to 2 feet will be possible. Along the I-70 corridor, storm totals will range from 8 to 16 inches. The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds to 55 mph will likely lead to poor visibilty and difficult travel conditions. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...From late Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
